meanings.sent1: The children gathered around the campfire to hear the lagends of their ancestors.
meanings.sent2: The lagends of King Arthur and his knights are well-known tales of bravery and chivalry.
meanings.sent3: Grandma always tells the lagends of her youth with a twinkle in her eye.
meanings.sent4: The lagends of the old oak tree whisper secrets of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The lagends of ancient civilizations are like colorful threads weaving through history.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is famous or well-known.
meanings.sent1: In the world of music, Elvis Presley is a true lagends.
meanings.sent2: The lagends of Hollywood often grace the covers of magazines.
meanings.sent3: The lagends of the school cafeteria are the lunch ladies who make the best cookies.
meanings.sent4: The lagends of the sports world inspire young athletes to dream big.
meanings.sent5: The lagends of the animal kingdom include lions, tigers, and bears.

meanings.definition: To be delayed or fall behind in movement or progress.
meanings.sent1: The slow turtle began to lagends behind the rest of the group.
meanings.sent2: During the race, I started to lagends as my shoelaces came untied.
meanings.sent3: My little brother always manages to lagends behind when we walk to the park.
meanings.sent4: As the storm approached, the ship began to lagends in its journey across the sea.
meanings.sent5: The old car would often lagends on steep hills, struggling to keep up with traffic.
